jparsec.ephem

Class IAU2006

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.ephem.IAU2006

  • public class IAU2006
extends java.lang.Object
    A set of methods to calculate matrices related to IAU2006 resolutions and coordinates transformations. Please note that IAU 2006 resolutions are supported in each individual ephemeris theory using equinox-based calculations, the methods in this class allows to obtain CIO-based coordinates of the objects. CIO-based calculations are currently not used actively inside JPARSEC. See Wallace and Capitaine, A&A 459, 981 (2006).
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      static class  IAU2006.CIO_EPHEMERIS
      The different possible ephemerides results referred to CIO.

    • Method Detail

      • getNPB

        public static Matrix getNPB(TimeElement time,
            ObserverElement observer,
            EphemerisElement eph)
                     throws JPARSECException
        Returns the Nutation-Precesion-Bias matrix (NPB) for a given instant. See the 'reference method' by Capitaine et al. at http://syrte.obspm.fr/iau2006/aa06_459.IAU06prec.pdf. Agreement is in the microarcsecond level.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object.
        observer - Observer object.
        eph - Ephemeris object.
        Returns:
        The NPB matrix.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getGCRS_to_CIRS

        public static Matrix getGCRS_to_CIRS(TimeElement time,
                     ObserverElement obs,
                     EphemerisElement eph)
                              throws JPARSECException
        Returns to matrix to transform coordinates in the GCRS (geocentric) to CIRS. See the 'reference method' by Capitaine et al. at http://syrte.obspm.fr/iau2006/aa06_459.IAU06prec.pdf. Agreement is in the microarcsecond level.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object.
        obs - Observer object.
        eph - Ephemeris object.
        Returns:
        The matrix.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getGCRS_to_TIRS

        public static Matrix getGCRS_to_TIRS(TimeElement time,
                     ObserverElement obs,
                     EphemerisElement eph)
                              throws JPARSECException
        Returns to matrix to transform coordinates in the GCRS (geocentric) to TIRS. See the 'reference method' by Capitaine et al. at http://syrte.obspm.fr/iau2006/aa06_459.IAU06prec.pdf. Agreement is in the microarcsecond level.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object.
        obs - Observer object.
        eph - Ephemeris object.
        Returns:
        The matrix.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getGCRS_to_ITRS

        public static Matrix getGCRS_to_ITRS(TimeElement time,
                     ObserverElement obs,
                     EphemerisElement eph)
                              throws JPARSECException
        Returns to matrix to transform coordinates in the GCRS (geocentric) to ITRS. See the 'reference method' by Capitaine et al. at http://syrte.obspm.fr/iau2006/aa06_459.IAU06prec.pdf. Agreement is in the microarcsecond level. Note correction for diurnal aberration is not included.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object.
        obs - Observer object.
        eph - Ephemeris object.
        Returns:
        The matrix.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • GCRS_to_topocentric

        public static LocationElement GCRS_to_topocentric(TimeElement time,
                                  ObserverElement obs,
                                  EphemerisElement eph,
                                  LocationElement input)
                                           throws JPARSECException
        Corrects coordinates from GCRS to topocentric, applying the GCRS to ICRS transform plus parallax and diurnal aberration.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object.
        obs - Observer object.
        eph - Ephemeris object.
        input - Input coordinates as right ascension, declination, and distance in GCRS. Distance in AU.
        Returns:
        Output coordinates as hour angle and declination.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • GCRS_to_apparent

        public static LocationElement GCRS_to_apparent(TimeElement time,
                               ObserverElement obs,
                               EphemerisElement eph,
                               LocationElement input)
                                        throws JPARSECException
        Corrects coordinates from GCRS to apparent, applying the GCRS to ICRS transform plus parallax, diurnal aberration, and refraction.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object.
        obs - Observer object.
        eph - Ephemeris object.
        input - Input coordinates as right ascension, declination, and distance in GCRS. Distance in AU.
        Returns:
        Output coordinates as hour angle and declination, corrected for refraction.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getEphemerisWithRespectCIO

        public static EphemElement getEphemerisWithRespectCIO(TimeElement time,
                                      ObserverElement obs,
                                      EphemerisElement eph,
                                      IAU2006.CIO_EPHEMERIS output)
                                               throws JPARSECException
        Returns ephemerides using matrices. Input objects should be valid to call Ephem.getEphemeris(TimeElement, ObserverElement, EphemerisElement, boolean). The full ephem flag is set to false when calling it.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object.
        obs - Observer object.
        eph - Ephemeris object.
        output - The type of coordinates to return in the right ascension and declination fields of the ephemerides object.
        Returns:
        The ephemerides. In case of topocentric or apparent output the right ascension is set using as local sidereal time the output from SiderealTime.apparentSiderealTime(TimeElement, ObserverElement, EphemerisElement), otherwise RA and DEC fields are set to the output from the corresponding transformation matrix from GCRS.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - In case of any error.

      • getStarEphemerisWithRespectCIO

        public static StarEphemElement getStarEphemerisWithRespectCIO(TimeElement time,
                                              ObserverElement obs,
                                              EphemerisElement eph,
                                              StarElement star,
                                              IAU2006.CIO_EPHEMERIS output)
                                                       throws JPARSECException
        Returns ephemerides for a star using matrices. Input objects should be valid to call StarEphem.starEphemeris(TimeElement, ObserverElement, EphemerisElement, StarElement, boolean). The full ephem flag is set to false when calling it.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object.
        obs - Observer object.
        eph - Ephemeris object.
        star - The star object. In case frame is not ICRF, it is transformed to ICRF and J2000 equinox and epoch.
        output - The type of coordinates to return in the right ascension and declination fields of the ephemerides object.
        Returns:
        The ephemerides. In case of topocentric or apparent output the right ascension is set using as local sidereal time the output from SiderealTime.apparentSiderealTime(TimeElement, ObserverElement, EphemerisElement), otherwise RA and DEC fields are set to the output from the corresponding transformation matrix from GCRS.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - In case of any error.

      • getSPlusHalfXY

        public static double getSPlusHalfXY(double T)
        Evaluates coefficients for s + X Y / 2.
        Parameters:
        T - Centuries from J2000.
        Returns:
        S + x * y * 0.5.

        Returns:
        The matrix.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.
